alert.note: Alert for Wallowa (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 11 at 3:59PM PDT until August 11 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pendleton Oregon has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Wallowa County in northeastern Oregon... * Until 445 PM PDT. * At 358 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northeast of Wallowa, or 16 miles north of Enterprise, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wallowa, Imnaha, Flora and Paradise. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
